input_text:
Job Title: Senior Transportation PS&E Engineer

Location: Dallas County, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
The Opportunity 

RS&H in Texas from RS&H on Vimeo .

 We are seeking a Senior Transportation PS&E Engineer in TX. 

The successful candidate will serve as a Project Manager taking a leadership role in project plan production, quality assurance/quality control, team development and supervision, client management, profitable project management, and developing collaborative partnerships. The candidate will have a proven record of successful PS&E delivery for TxDOT and be able to contribute to the development and implementation of a business plan in coordination with RS&H local office and state leaders. The candidate will have the ability to learn internal RS&H processes for project management, financial budgeting/billing, business and contract transactions, negotiations with clients, and human resource activities.

 Background  : RS&H began providing PS&E services to TxDOT in the early 2000’s through an acquisition of a small Houston-based firm. For more than 20 years, RS&H has provided these services at a high level, while also diversifying and growing our offerings throughout Texas. Today, more than 200 RS&H associates throughout the Lone Star state continue to serve TxDOT and other clients as Prime in markets including Aviation, Construction Management, Federal, Defense, Aerospace, and the Private Sector. TxDOT continues to be one of our firm’s top clients, and we are doubling down on that commitment through the expansion of our firm’s core transportation design business, our largest service group in the company. With more than 1,400 associates across 70 offices in the country, our firm has been growing rapidly and our employee-ownership model has provided our associates the opportunity to thrive and take ownership of that success. Success in Texas is integral to our firm’s strategic plan, and we are seeking like-minded individuals to help us be the best partner to TxDOT that we can be.

Objectives

 Technical Excellence: The successful candidate will place emphasis on delivering an industry-best product, foremost. We’re only as good as our last project, and our quality will be the reason our clients re-select RS&H.  Client Experience: The successful candidate will listen first, be highly responsive, provide options, advise on difficult decisions, always act as a good faith partner, and deliver on client expectations and our promises.  People Development: Build on existing S&E and PS&E staff, including mentoring of current associates and hiring in additional associates/teams. The successful candidate can expect to have creative control with staff decisions and value the time and effort it takes to develop associates/teams.  Teamwork: Work cooperatively with other leaders in Texas and throughout the firm to form a cohesive production team.  Business Success: Identifying TxDOT PS&E clients and pursuing potential opportunities in coordination with our firm’s strategic plan for Texas.  Local Focus: Contribute to of an office-specific business plan that meets or exceeds financial goals for PS&E backlog. The successful candidate will also support their community and TxDOT transportation industry. 

Requirements

 ABET-accredited Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering  Professional Engineer (PE) license in Texas  Minimum 15 years of progressive leadership experience within the field of civil engineering/roadway/drainage/structures/traffic engineering studies  Project management experience working directly with TxDOT, toll authorities, or other local transportation agencies  Plans, Specifications and Estimate (PS&E) experience on complex transportation projects and administering contracts  Strong supervisory skills leading multiple teams and people, and established client relationships/marketing and business development experience  Excellent organizational skills with attention to detail along with overall quality control and management 

Preferred Qualifications

 Bachelor or Master of Science in civil engineering degree, or other 

Benefits

 Click Here for Full Benefits Information  Additional benefits/compensation negotiable for the right candidate 

 Please note: no agency representation or submissions will be recognized for this vacancy. Candidates should apply directly to this role to be considered.  I t is the responsibility of all third-party recruiting and employment agencies to know and adhere to our recruiting policy .

 Please note: no agency representation or submissions will be recognized for this vacancy. Candidates should apply directly to this role to be considered.  I t is the responsibility of all third-party recruiting and employment agencies to know and adhere to our recruiting policy .

 The Team 

From managed toll lanes and long-range corridor plans to complex interchanges, major roadway, and segmental bridge designs, our teams provide the highest quality planning, environmental and engineering design solutions to our clients. Each day, we partner with transportation agencies and local governments across the country to keep our communities moving and improving the overall quality of life. By joining our team, you too can lead the evolution of transportation.

The Company

RS&H provides fully integrated architecture, engineering, and consulting services to help clients realize their most complex facility and infrastructure projects for land, air, and space. We are committed to bringing extraordinary solutions to our clients through the promise of imagination, ingenuity, and innovation. With a tradition of excellence that began in 1941, we are consistently ranked among the nation’s top 100 design firms. We attribute our success to an unwavering commitment to our core values of: integrity, quality service, business success and valuing associates.

 An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. 

Please view Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP here.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
